content.raw:
* For Homebrew, I think @scpeters can give you better guidance on that PR
* For Windows, I'd try copying what is done on the libs that are building successfully, I think a change from `project-default-devel-windows.bat` to `generic-default-devel-windows.bat` is part of it

Since this is still in version 0, I think there is no need to be backwards compatible, i.e. we won't keep supporting previous zero versions. Actually, this PR probably prompts a bump to 0.2.0.

For testing your changes on Jenkins, you can start a new branch on `release-tools` and use that when you trigger the build.
content.html:
• For Homebrew, I think @scpeters can give you better guidance on that PR
  • For Windows, I'd try copying what is done on the libs that are building successfully, I think a change from project-default-devel-windows.bat to generic-default-devel-windows.bat is part of it

Since this is still in version 0, I think there is no need to be backwards compatible, i.e. we won't keep supporting previous zero versions. Actually, this PR probably prompts a bump to 0.2.0.

For testing your changes on Jenkins, you can start a new branch on release-tools and use that when you trigger the build.
